creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
Hi,

in the Adobe SVG Viewer (ASV), everything gets rendered nice and smooth:
 http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/squiggle/mascots_asv.png
; in Squiggle, the black lines of the Apache feather are rendered jagged, in the
the hash bang slash line, the characters are too thin IMHO, and the outlines of
the Ruby logo are also rendered differently
 http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/squiggle/mascots_squiggle.png
.
The main issue are th black thin lines in the feather, which are get rendered
jagged.

You can see most of the differences by flipping (alt-tab) forth and back quickly
between the two screenshots (or better, between the actual canvases of ASV and
Squiggle, with the SVG loaded (see URL above in the URL field)).

TIA,
Tobi

The problem is with JDK rendering, there is nothing Batik can do.
I might mention that using curves rather than lots of small lines generally
gives better results.
creator: deweese@apache.org
deweese@apache.org
text: A fix for the JKD issue was found.

With current CVS you can add shape-rendering="geometricPrecision" and
the 'jaggies' go away.  Additionally for the text you can use 
text-rendering="optimizeLegibility" and the text will be rendered with 
a uniform 1pixel stroke, but it will not be anti-aliased (which might
actually be good for that logo) - sorry can't do any better than this.
creator: deweese@apache.org
